TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit LinkedResourceCollection extends System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection`1<class System.Net.Mail.LinkedResource> implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Stores linked resources to be sent as part of an e-mail message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An instance of the LinkedResourceCollection class is returned by the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.LinkedResources%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void ClearItems() cil managed
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Call Dispose when you are finished using the <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection>. The Dispose method leaves the <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection> in an unusable state. After calling Dispose, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection> occupied. For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
This method invokes <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.Dispose%2A> on all views in this collection. This method is called by the <xref:System.Net.Mail.MailMessage.Dispose%2A> method. You do not need to call it in your application.
> [!NOTE] > Always call Dispose before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection>. Otherwise, the resources it is using are not freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection> object's `Finalize` method.
